attributes.action: get fuel suppliers to reduce the cost of Liquid Petroleum Gas in the same way pressure was bought to bear for reducing petrol and diesel prices
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Much is made by supermarkets of how they are selling petrol for less than one pound a litre. However at no time have they reduced the cost of a litre of Liquid Petroleum Gas. The price has risen steadily from around 34p a litre two years ago to a ridiculous 56pence a litre - this is over 60% rise in price. LPG vehicle owners have had to suffer this as they are small in number and do not attract sympathy from other fuel users. However conversion costs are often around £2000. Why convert - it is cleaner and more environmentally friendly. The govermnent used to recognise this with conversion incentives and do not now support this subsidy. All that is asked here is for equity for LPG users.I understand the same is true for LPG home users.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
